IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: WE ARE A NONPROFIT, COMMUNITY BASED HEALTH CARE NETWORK WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROMOTE PROFESSIONAL, COMPETENT, ETHICAL AND COMPASSIONATE HEALTH CARE IN THE NAME OF CHRIST TO INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: WE ARE A NONPROFIT, COMMUNITY BASED HEALTH CARE NETWORK WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROMOTE PROFESSIONAL, COMPETENT, ETHICAL AND COMPASSIONATE HEALTH CARE IN THE NAME OF CHRIST TO INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Description: PROVIDE INPATIENT, OUTPATIENT AND LONG TERM CARE SERVICES AS WELL AS ASSISTED LIVING AND INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES TO HENDERSON AND THE SURROUNDING AREA. SERVICES PROVIDED THIS YEAR INCLUDE 684 ACUTE AND SWING-BED DAYS, 14,344 LONG-TERM CARE DAYS, 4,627 ASSISTED LIVING DAYS AND NUMEROUS OUTPATIENT VISITS.

OtherAssets.Description: CASH SURRENDER VALUE OF LIFE INSURAN

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 2, PART V, LINE 4
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: 2,524 IS SET ASIDE IN A DEBT RESERVE FUND AS REQUIRED UNDER THE LOAN OBLIGATION. 21,679 IS SET ASIDE IN DONOR RESTICTED FUNDS FOR THE PURCHASE OF MINOR EQUIPMENT FOR USE BY THE HOSPITAL, LONG-TERM CARE AND ASSISTED LIVING.

HEALTH SERVICES HAS ADOPTED FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD NEWLY ISSUED GUIDANCE RELATED TO ACCOUNTING FOR ANY UNCERTAINTIES IN INCOME TAXES AND REQUIRED DISCLOSURES THEREON. THE PROVISION PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD AND MEASUREMENT PRINCIPLES FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN ON A TAX RETURN THAT ARE NOT CERTAIN TO BE REALIZED. HEALTH SERVICES HAS NO RESERVES FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AT JUNE 30, 2010 OR 2009. ADDITIONALLY, HEALTH SERVICES HAS NOT RECOGNIZED ANY INTEREST OR PENALTIES IN RELATION TO TAX FILINGS AS OF OR FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2010 AND 2009. FINALLY, TAX YEARS 2007 TO 2010 ALL REMAIN OPEN AND ARE SUBJECT TO POTENTIAL EXAMINATION BY TAXING JURISDICTIONS.

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: EXPENSES INCLUDE A PROVISION FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS TO ALLOW FOR ESTIMATED UNCOLLECTIBLE ACCOUNTS. THIS PROVISION IS BASED ON PAST EXPERIENCE AND ON ANALYSIS OF CURRENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE COLLECTIBILITY. ACCOUNTS ARE CONSIDERED DELINQUENT BASED ON PASSAGE OF A SPECIFIED PERIOD OF TIME AND CONSIDERATION OF PAYMENT HISTORY. AS A RESULT, THERE IS AT LEAST A REASONABLE POSSIBILITY THAT RECORDED ESTIMATES WILL CHANGE BY A MATERIAL AMOUNT IN THE NEAR TERM. ACCOUNTS DEEMED UNCOLLECTIBLE ARE CHARGED TO THE ALLOWANCE IN THE YEAR THEY ARE DEEMED UNCOLLECTIBLE. THE COSTING METHODOLOGY FOR LINE 2 IS ACTUAL REVENUE WRITTEN OFF AND SENT TO COLLECTION MULTIPLIED BY THE OVERALL COST/CHARGE RATIO PER THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION REVIEWED THEIR BAD DEBTS WRITTEN OFF DURING THE YEAR AS WELL AS PAST EXPERIENCE WITH PATIENTS SERVED AND DETERMINED APPROXIMATELY 10% OF BAD DEBT ACCOUNTS WRITTEN OFF WOULD HAVE QUALIFIED FOR CHARITY CARE IF THE INDIVIDUALS WHOULD HAVE COMPLETED THE APPLICATION PROCESS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: HENDERSON HEALTH CARE CONDUCTS A COMMUNITY NEEDS ASSESSMENT EVERY TWO YEARS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: IT IS NOTED THAT HENDERSON HEALTH CARE OFFERS CHARITY CARE IN THE ADMISSION FORMS THAT ALL PATIENTS SIGN WHEN THEY COME TO THE CLINIC AND HOSPITAL. ALSO, IN COLLECTION LETTERS PATIENT'S ARE ENCOURAGED TO CONTACT THE HOSPITAL IF THEY ARE INTERESTD IN APPLYING FOR CHARITY CARE. LASTLY, CHARITY CARE IS VERBALLY EXPLAINED TO PATIENTS IF THEY CALL STATING THEY CAN'T PAY FOR THEIR MEDICAL BILLS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: THE HOSPITAL SERVICE AREA INCLUDES THE IMMEDIATE RESIDENTS OF THE TOWN OF HENDERSON AND ALSO OTHER RESIDENTS OF YORK COUNTY AND OTHER SURROUNDING COUNTYS. THE SERVICE AREA IS PRIMARILY RURAL WITH AN ESTIMATED COUNTY POPULATION OF 13,800. THE POPULATION IS ESTIMATED 96.5% WHITE, WITH LESS THAN 2% EACH OF OTHER DEMOGRAPHIC DECENT CATEGORIES. THE MEDIAN HOUSEHOLD INCOME IS APPROXIMATELY 44,700 WITH 8.5% OF PEOPLE BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: A MAJORITY OF THE HENDERSON HEALTH CARE SERVICES' GOVERNING BODY IS COMPRISED OF PERSONS WHO RESIDE IN THE ORGANIZATION'S PRIMARY SERVICE AREA WHO ARE NEITHER EMPLOYEES NOR CONTRACTORS OF THE HENDERSON HEALTH CARE SERVICES, NOR FAMILY MEMBERS THEREOF. IN ADDITION, THE HENDERSON HEALTH CARE SERVICES CONTINUALLY APPLIES SURPLUS FUNDS TOWARDS THE IMPROVEMENT OF PATIENT CARE, SUCH AS EXPANSION AND REMODELING OF FACILITIES AND THE PURCHASE OF NEW/UPDATED MEDICAL EQUIPMENT.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Identifier: COMPENSATION CONTINGENT UPON REVENUES OF ORGANIZATION
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 5A
Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: IN ACCORDANCE WITH RELATED EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS, ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION IS PAID BASED ON REVENUES GENERATED BY EACH PROVIDER, AS DEFINED. THESE ADDITIONAL AMOUNTS HAVE BEEN LISTED AS INCENTIVE COMPENSATION IN SCHEDULE J, PART II, COLUMN B II.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALAN JANZEN KEVIN POSTIER BOD MEMBER BOD CHAIR BUSINESS CHRISTOPHER VANDERNECK ALAN JANZEN PHYSICIAN BOD MEMBER BUSINESS

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A FINAL COPY OF FORM 990, AS IT WILL BE ELECTRONICALLY FILED, IS REVIEWED BY ALL VOTING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD. THIS REVIEW WAS COMPLETED AT THE REGULAR BOARD MEETING ON JANUARY 27, 2011, BEFORE IT WAS ELECTRONICALLY FILED. A DETAILED REVIEW IS DONE BY MANAGEMENT AND THEN A GENERAL REVIEW IS DONE BY THE BOARD.
MANAGEMENT CONTINUALLY REVIEWS OFFICER, DIRECTOR, TRUSTEE AND KEY EMPLOYEE RELATIONSHIPS WITH HENDERSON HEALTH CARE SERVICES IN ORDER TO VERIFY COMPLIANCE WITH ALL ADOPTED POLICIES.

COMPENSATION IS DECIDED UPON BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS WHO UTILIZE COMPENSATION SURVEYS CONDUCTED BY THE NEBRASKA HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION. THE HOSPITAL ALSO UTILIZES AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT AS CONSIDERED NECESSARY.

COMPENSATION IS DECIDED UPON BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS WHO UTILIZE COMPENSATION SURVEYS CONDUCTED BY THE NEBRASKA HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION. THE HOSPITAL ALSO UTILIZES AND INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT AS CONSIDERED NECESSARY.

GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE DISTRIBUTED AT THE ANNUAL MEETING TO THOSE IN ATTENDANCE AND ARE ALSO AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, COLUMN(B) - AVERAGE HOURS PER WEEK DEVOTED TO THE ORGANIZATION THE HOURS FOR DR. CHRISTOPHER VANDERNECK AND DR. JAMES OHRT INCLUDE ALL HOURS SPENT IN THE CLINIC AND HOSPITAL, AS WELL AS EMERGENCY ROOM ON-CALL HOURS AND BACKUP ON-CALL HOURS. FORM 990, SCH. L, PART IV, - BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING INTERESTED PERSONS HENDERSON STATE BANK IS CONSIDERED AN INTERESTED PERSON FOR PURPOSES OF SCHEDULE L AS ALAN JANZEN AND KEVIN POSTIER ARE CURRENT DIRECTORS OF BOTH THE HENDERSON HEALTH CARE SERVICES AND HENDERSON STATE BANK. KEVIN POSTIER IS ALSO THE PRESIDENT OF HENDERSON STATE BANK.
